# Pipeline


<!-- WARNING: THIS FILE WAS AUTOGENERATED! DO NOT EDIT! -->

The
[`Report`](https://franckalbinet.github.io/iomeval/pipeline.html#report)
class orchestrates the full evaluation pipeline:

1.  **Download** - Fetch PDFs from IOM evaluation repository
2.  **OCR** - Convert PDFs to markdown with heading hierarchy
3.  **Extract** - Pull core sections from converted documents
4.  **Map** - Identify which standardized framework themes are central
    to each report, including the [Strategic Results Framework
    (SRF)](https://srf.iom.int) (Enablers, Cross-cutting Priorities, and
    Outputs) and [Global Compact for
    Migration](https://www.un.org/en/development/desa/population/migration/generalassembly/docs/globalcompact/A_RES_73_195.pdf)
    objectives

## Report class

The
[`Report`](https://franckalbinet.github.io/iomeval/pipeline.html#report)
class wraps an
[`Evaluation`](https://franckalbinet.github.io/iomeval/readers.html#evaluation)
and provides methods for the four pipeline stages: download → ocr →
extract → map

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/pipeline.py#L26"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Report

>  Report (ev:iomeval.readers.Evaluation, pdf_url:str=None,
>              results_path:str='data/results')

*An evaluation report with full pipeline support*

<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Default</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>ev</td>
<td>Evaluation</td>
<td></td>
<td>The evaluation metadata object</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>pdf_url</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>None</td>
<td>Optional direct URL to PDF</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>results_path</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>data/results</td>
<td>Path to save/load results</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

#### Creating reports

Create a report from a URL:

``` python
evals = load_evals('files/test/evaluations.json')
url = "https://evaluation.iom.int/sites/g/files/tmzbdl151/files/docs/resources/Abridged%20Evaluation%20Report_%20Final_Olta%20NDOJA.pdf"
report = Report.from_url(url, evals, results_path='files/test/results')
report
```

## Report: Final Evaluation of the EU-IOM Joint Initiative for migrant protection and reintegration in the horn of Africa

**Year:** 2023 | **Organization:** IOM  
**ID:** `49d2fba781b6a7c0d94577479636ee6f`

**Processing Status:**  
✓ PDF downloaded

**Documents:** 5 available

Or from a title:

``` python
title = 'Evaluation of IOM Accountability to Affected Populations'
report = Report.from_title(title, evals, results_path='files/test/results')
report
```

## Report: Evaluation of IOM Accountability to Affected Populations

**Year:** 2025 | **Organization:** IOM  
**ID:** `6c3c2cf3fa479112967612b0baddab72`

**Processing Status:**  
Not processed

**Documents:** 4 available

<div>

> **Note**
>
> When creating a report from title (rather than URL), if multiple PDFs
> are available for an evaluation, the `ocr()` and downstream methods
> will process the first PDF found in the download directory.

</div>

## Persistence

Reports automatically save after each pipeline stage. Use
[`load_report`](https://franckalbinet.github.io/iomeval/pipeline.html#load_report)
to resume from any checkpoint.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/pipeline.py#L91"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

#### Resuming from checkpoint

``` python
report = load_report('49d2fba781b6a7c0d94577479636ee6f', path='files/test/results')
report
```

**Documents:** 5 available

## Pipeline Methods

The pipeline has four main stages: `download` → `ocr` → `extract` →
`map_*`

### Download

Downloads the evaluation PDF from IOM’s repository.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/pipeline.py#L118"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Report.download

>  Report.download (dst:str='data/pdfs', force:bool=False)

*Download evaluation PDF to `dst`/`eval_id`/*

<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Default</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>dst</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>data/pdfs</td>
<td>Destination directory for PDFs</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>force</td>
<td>bool</td>
<td>False</td>
<td>Force re-download</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Returns</strong></td>
<td><strong>Report</strong></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

``` python
url = "https://evaluation.iom.int/sites/g/files/tmzbdl151/files/docs/resources/Abridged%20Evaluation%20Report_%20Final_Olta%20NDOJA.pdf"
report = Report.from_url(url, evals, results_path='files/test/results')
_ = report.download(dst='files/test/pdfs')
```

``` python
Path('files/test/pdfs/49d2fba781b6a7c0d94577479636ee6f').ls()
```

### OCR

Runs OCR on the PDF using Mistral’s API and converts to markdown with
proper heading hierarchy.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/pipeline.py#L130"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Report.ocr

>  Report.ocr (dst:str='data/md', add_img_desc:bool=True, force:bool=False,
>                  **kwargs)

*Run OCR on PDF and fix heading hierarchy*

``` python
await report.ocr(dst='files/test/md', add_img_desc=False)
```

### Extract

Extracts key sections (executive summary, findings, recommendations,
conclusions) from the markdown.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/pipeline.py#L148"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

>  Report.extract (force:bool=False, **kwargs)

## Report: Final Evaluation of the EU-IOM Joint Initiative for migrant protection and reintegration in the horn of Africa

**Year:** 2023 | **Organization:** IOM

tokens)

**Documents:** 5 available

``` python
print(report.sections[:1000])
```

    ## 1. Introduction  ... page 4

    In 2016, the EU and IOM launched the EU-IOM Joint Initiative for Migrant Protection and Reintegration, with as overall objective "To contribute to facilitating orderly, safe, regular and rights-based migration through the facilitation of dignified voluntary return and the implementation of development-focused and sustainable reintegration policies and processes". The EU-IOM Joint Initiative in the Horn of Africa (JI-HOA) ${ }^{1}$ commenced in March 2017 in the Khartoum Process countries, with a focus on Djibouti, Ethiopia, Somalia, and Sudan. ${ }^{2}$ The programme was coordinated by a Regional Coordination Unit (RCU) based in the IOM Regional Office for the East and Horn of Africa region (Nairobi, Kenya).

    In accordance with the programme planning, the JI-HoA underwent a Mid-Term Evaluation in 2019 and a Final Independent Evaluation in 2022/2023, covering the 2017-2022 period, conducted by PPMI Group and commissioned by IOM. The evaluation covered the

## Thematic mapping

Map extracted sections to IOM’s strategic frameworks (SRF and GCM). Each
mapping method can be run independently after `extract()`.

### Map enablers

Maps to Strategic Results Framework enablers (organizational
capabilities).

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/pipeline.py#L185"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Report.map_enablers

>  Report.map_enablers (force:bool=False, **kwargs)

*Map report sections to Strategic Results Framework enablers*

<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Default</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>force</td>
<td>bool</td>
<td>False</td>
<td>Re-run even if already completed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>kwargs</td>
<td>VAR_KEYWORD</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

Here let’s consider we don’t want to start the pipeline from scratch and
want to resume where we left some time ago:

``` python
# Resuming where left
report = load_report('49d2fba781b6a7c0d94577479636ee6f', path='files/test/results')

# Mapping enablers
report.map_enablers(model='claude-haiku-4-5')
```

## Report: Final Evaluation of the EU-IOM Joint Initiative for migrant protection and reintegration in the horn of Africa

**Year:** 2023 | **Organization:** IOM  
**ID:** `49d2fba781b6a7c0d94577479636ee6f`

**Processing Status:**  
✓ PDF downloaded | ✓ Markdown converted | ✓ Sections extracted (~14858
tokens) | ✓ Mappings: enablers

**Documents:** 5 available

``` python
sort_by_centrality(report.mappings['enablers'])[:2]
```

    [{'theme_id': '4',
      'theme_title': 'Data and evidence',
      'centrality_score': 0.75,
      'reasoning': "Data and evidence is a PRIMARY organizational focus. Section 4.3.1.1 demonstrates JI exceeded targets for field studies (20 vs 19). The Regional Data Hub receives extensive praise (Section 5.1, Recommendation 4). Section 4.3.3.1 documents 36 M&E tools established across countries. Conclusions (5.1) emphasize JI's important contributions to data availability and research on migration trends. Data collection systems and evidence generation are core to effectiveness assessment.",
      'confidence': 'high'},
     {'theme_id': '2',
      'theme_title': 'Partnership',
      'centrality_score': 0.72,
      'reasoning': 'Partnership is a MAJOR component throughout the report. Section 4.2.2 extensively analyzes alignment with regional actors (IGAD, AU) and complementarity with other initiatives. Section 4.1.2.2 notes 82% of partners found capacity building useful. Recommendations 1-3 explicitly address partnership strengthening, capacity building of partners, and ownership. The integrated approach inherently depends on multi-stakeholder partnerships across government, NGOs, and UN agencies.',
      'confidence': 'high'}]


    [{'theme_id': '3',
      'theme_title': 'Protection-centred',
      'centrality_score': 0.78,
      'reasoning': "Protection-centred approach is substantial evaluative lens throughout. Section 4.3.2 explicitly evaluates 'Safe, humane, dignified voluntary return processes,' with findings on AVR outcomes (9,025 migrants returned, 95% satisfaction with travel arrangements). Section 4.1.1.1 assesses migrant needs including protection from dangerous environments/detention. Section 4.3.3.1 addresses psychosocial support as protection dimension. Multiple recommendations (4, 6) emphasize continued protection support. However, not the primary evaluation focus—program evaluation uses it as major criterion rather than thematic focus on protection itself.",
      'confidence': 'high'},
     {'theme_id': '2',
      'theme_title': 'Equality, Diversity & Inclusion',
      'centrality_score': 0.52,
      'reasoning': 'Report demonstrates EDI elements but inconsistently. Section 4.1.1.3 notes community participation survey (1,232 respondents, 333 female). Section 4.3.2.1 mentions gender mainstreaming through SGBV awareness raising. However, systematic assessment of sex/gender/age/disability inclusion is absent. Report does not use EDI as evaluative criterion, nor does it examine barriers to inclusion or representation of vulnerable groups in program design. EDI appears aspirational rather than systematically evaluated against defined targets.',
      'confidence': 'medium'}]

      'theme_title': 'Objective 21: Cooperate In Facilitating Safe And Dignified Return And Readmission, As Well As Sustainable Reintegration',
      'centrality_score': 0.96,
      'reasoning': "THIS IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS. The programme's stated objective is 'dignified voluntary return and sustainable reintegration' (Introduction, Section 2.1). All five pillars support this objective. Specific Objectives 2 and 3 directly address safe return (Section 4.3.2) and sustainable reintegration (Section 4.3.3). Actions on cooperation frameworks (a), gender-responsive return (b), identification and travel documents (c), consular support (d), monitoring (f), child protection (g), sustainable reintegration (h), and community needs (i) are extensively discussed. Recommendations 4 and 6 prioritize continuation of AVR and integrated reintegration. Entire evaluation structure revolves around return/reintegration effectiveness, relevance, and sustainability.",
      'confidence': 'high'},
     {'theme_id': '7',
      'theme_title': 'Objective 7: Address and Reduce Vulnerabilities in Migration',
      'centrality_score': 0.76,
      'reasoning': "Vulnerability reduction is a major pillar. The programme explicitly targets vulnerable migrants: 'identification of vulnerabilities and provide individualized support' (Conclusions). Actions on human rights-based approaches (a), identification and assistance (b), gender-responsive policies (c), and victim protection (b, e, f) are extensively discussed. MHPSS support addresses psychosocial vulnerabilities; protection of returnees from stigma and re-exploitation is central to reintegration findings. However, vulnerability is primarily addressed within reintegration context rather than as standalone theme; some gaps in MHPSS implementation noted (Section 4.1.1.2).",
      'confidence': 'high'}]

### Map outputs

Maps to SRF outputs. If `gcm_ids` not provided, uses the top GCM
objective from prior mapping.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/pipeline.py#L224"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Report.map_outputs

>  Report.map_outputs (gcm_ids=None, force:bool=False, **kwargs)

*Map report sections to Strategic Results Framework outputs*

<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Default</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>gcm_ids</td>
<td>NoneType</td>
<td>None</td>
<td>GCM IDs to filter SRF objectives</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>force</td>
<td>bool</td>
<td>False</td>
<td>Re-run even if already completed</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>kwargs</td>
<td>VAR_KEYWORD</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

``` python
report = load_report('49d2fba781b6a7c0d94577479636ee6f', path='files/test/results')
report.map_outputs(model='claude-haiku-4-5')
```

      'reasoning': 'The report extensively documents capacity building as a core objective (Specific Objective 1, Section 4.3.1). Recommendations (Recommendation 4) call for continued Regional Data Hub support. This is a primary program deliverable explicitly assessed.',
      'confidence': 'high'}]

### Map all themes

Convenience method to run all mapping stages in sequence.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/pipeline.py#L239"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Report.map_all

>  Report.map_all (**kwargs)

### Run full pipeline

Run all four stages in sequence on a single evaluation report. This is a
convenience wrapper around the individual
[`Report`](https://franckalbinet.github.io/iomeval/pipeline.html#report)
methods for processing reports from start to finish.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/pipeline.py#L250"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### run_pipeline

>  run_pipeline (url:str, evals:list, pdf_dst:str='data/pdfs',
>                    md_dst:str='data/md', results_path:str='data/results',
>                    ocr_kwargs:dict=None, force:bool|set=False, **kwargs)

*Run complete pipeline: download → ocr → extract → map_themes*

<table>
<colgroup>
<col style="width: 6%" />
<col style="width: 25%" />
<col style="width: 34%" />
<col style="width: 34%" />
</colgroup>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Default</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>url</td>
<td>str</td>
<td></td>
<td>URL of the evaluation PDF</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>evals</td>
<td>list</td>
<td></td>
<td>List of <a
href="https://franckalbinet.github.io/iomeval/readers.html#evaluation"><code>Evaluation</code></a>
objects to search</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>pdf_dst</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>data/pdfs</td>
<td>Destination directory for PDFs</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>md_dst</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>data/md</td>
<td>Destination directory for markdown files</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>results_path</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>data/results</td>
<td>Path to save/load results</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>ocr_kwargs</td>
<td>dict</td>
<td>None</td>
<td>Additional arguments passed to ocr (e.g. add_img_desc, model)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>force</td>
<td>bool | set</td>
<td>False</td>
<td>Force re-run: True for all, or set of step names
{‘download’,‘ocr’,‘extract’,‘enablers’,‘ccps’,‘gcm’,‘outputs’}</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>kwargs</td>
<td>VAR_KEYWORD</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Returns</strong></td>
<td><strong>Report</strong></td>
<td></td>
<td><strong>Fully processed report with all mappings</strong></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

``` python
evals = load_evals('files/test/evaluations.json')
url = "https://evaluation.iom.int/sites/g/files/tmzbdl151/files/docs/resources/Abridged%20Evaluation%20Report_%20Final_Olta%20NDOJA.pdf"
report = await run_pipeline(
    url, 
    evals, 
    pdf_dst='files/test/pdfs', 
    md_dst='files/test/md', 
    results_path='files/test/results', 
    ocr_kwargs=dict(add_img_desc=False), 
    force=False,
    model='claude-haiku-4-5'
    )

report
```

    INFO:root:Creating report from URL...
    INFO:root:Step 1/7: Downloading PDF...
    INFO:root:Step 2/7: Running OCR...
    INFO:root:Step 3/7: Extracting sections...
    INFO:root:Step 4/7: Mapping enablers...
    INFO:root:Step 5/7: Mapping CCPs...
    INFO:root:Step 6/7: Mapping GCM objectives...
    INFO:root:Step 7/7: Mapping outputs...
    INFO:root:Pipeline complete!

## Report: Final Evaluation of the EU-IOM Joint Initiative for migrant protection and reintegration in the horn of Africa

**Year:** 2023 | **Organization:** IOM  
**ID:** `49d2fba781b6a7c0d94577479636ee6f`

**Processing Status:**  
✓ PDF downloaded | ✓ Markdown converted | ✓ Sections extracted (~14858
tokens) | ✓ Mappings: enablers, ccps, gcm, outputs

**Documents:** 5 available

Or, if we prefer to re-run (force) only the last two steps:

``` python
report = await run_pipeline(
    url, 
    evals, 
    pdf_dst='files/test/pdfs', 
    md_dst='files/test/md', 
    results_path='files/test/results', 
    ocr_kwargs=dict(add_img_desc=False), 
    force={'gcm', 'outputs'},  # Only re-run these two steps
    model='claude-haiku-4-5'
)

report
```

    Creating report from URL...
    Step 1/7: Downloading PDF...
    Step 2/7: Running OCR...
    Step 3/7: Extracting sections...
    Step 4/7: Mapping enablers...
    Step 5/7: Mapping CCPs...
    Step 6/7: Mapping GCM objectives...
    Step 7/7: Mapping outputs...
    Pipeline complete!
